snippet: Cognitive dissonance was on display in Las Vegas. Fans bought mounds of Floyd Mayweather swag all week, but he was booed at the arena, while Manny Pacquiao got cheers.
abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column holds that boxing match between Floyd Mayweather Jr and Manny Pacquiao was not as important as promoters made it seem; notes cognitive dissonance of fans who profess dislike for Mayweather based on his personal failings while still purchasing his merchandise.
lead_paragraph: Cognitive dissonance was on display in Las Vegas. Fans bought mounds of Floyd Mayweather swag all week, but he was booed at the arena, while Manny Pacquiao got cheers.

headline.print_headline: A Preening Champion, Glorified and Reviled
headline.main: Mayweather Wins, Preens and Is Booed
